entry.title: We Could Be Heroes - A SuperBat Love Story
entry.summary:
Author: xxEmilee_Lunaxx

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 122,463Chapters: 42/?Kudos: 390

Summary: "I’ve made a lot of mistakes in my life, and for a long time, I thought I’d continue to fall into darkness. But Clark is like a shining light. He inspires me to be a better person.” Bruce Wayne and Clark Kent both maintain a strong sense of justice and fight for peace in their respective cities. However, both are struggling to maintain order alone, and are weighed down by a lost sense of identity and the loneliness that stems from the isolation of living a double life. After a chance encounter, the pair agree to form a Justice League to address the growing threat to Earth's security. As they learn to work together, new feelings blossom, and the heroes soon find themselves leaning on each other for support and comfort. Slow-burn romance. Bat-family drama. Justice League shenanigans. Bruce being a rich kid with issues. Superman being an innocent lad. Your favorite black cat/golden retriever boys are in for a wild ride.

entry.title: A Kryptonian and His Gladiator
entry.summary:
Author: Eyeslikedawn

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 46,391Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 155

Summary: Kryptonian society on the conquered planet Earth is complicated to say the least. When Lord Kal-El's house-guard is slain he decides to rebuild his ranks by purchasing a prized gladiator from Gotham City. His name is Bruce Wayne but the fans of the arena know him as Batman. Regardless of what they call him, though, with the human's stoic demeanor, and grim attitude, Kal has certainly bought more than he bargained for.

entry.title: You can take the boy from by the circus
entry.summary:
Author: Shelbyino

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,193Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 58

Summary: Damian Al-Ghul Wayne had everything at one point. He was a prince. Ibn al Xu'ffasch. Son of the bat. Heir to the demon. He had never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his palace in Nanda Parbat. He had never asked to be shipped to a gloomy, grey city. Even when his father kept taking in orphans and ruining his plans for inheritance, Damian stood steadfast. But then his father died, leaving behind his newest orphan. A tiny acrobat with watery blue eyes and black curls, who spoke no English. Damian knew the boy never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his circus troupe. Damian knew he needed to be there for him.

entry.title: Clinging to What's Lost
entry.summary:
Author: Dracula4life

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,051Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 8

Summary: Jason Todd thought he had moved past the pain of his past. Willis and Catherine were far behind him, along with the Joker and a year of torture. But when Jason comes home to his husband Roy overdosing on the couch, he realizes that the life he worked for was falling from his fingertips with each passing moment."Jason considered himself a pretty happy person. He lived with his charming husband Roy, and their adorable daughter Lian, and Jason went to Wayne Manor every Sunday for dinner. He and Bruce were as close as they could be, and Jason called his siblings every few weeks to catch up. Alfred was getting older, but Jason would still visit to help cook. Jason’s joking reference to Clark as ‘Pops’ had turned less sarcastic with each remark.So of course something had to screw things up."

entry.title: The Company We Keep
entry.summary:
Author: WrenA

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,429Chapters: 8/11Kudos: 96

Summary: They say you can tell a person by the company they keep and all Barry could say about Superman was that he was far from the goodie-two-shoes everyone made him out to be initially. If you were to go by said company:- The colleagues at the Daily Planet and especially Lois and Jimmy- Clark's parents who always send sweets- Clark's close friend, Thomas, who sports a permanent stubble, disheveled hair and dark circles under the eyes- The mysterious 'B' who Superman sometimes calls to call in a favor when something requires a more tricky investigation- Nightwing, who is part of the league but acts incredibly familiar to Supes- An assortment of friends that he keeps mentioning- A (possible) crime lord whose file keeps getting deleted from the Watchtower databases- An array of vigilantes that absolutely refuse to join the league and have an unhealthy obsession for bats- THE BATMAN!? THE BATMAN IS REAL and does Superman know BATMAN!?- Lex Luthor, a homicidal billionaire- Bruce Wayne, not a homicidal billionaire, just annoying- Superman's kids?!? Or glimpses into the life of Superman over time, as seen through the eyes of one Barry Allen.

entry.title: Always and Forever
entry.summary:
Author: Iriley

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,463Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 312

Summary: Now that Peter’s portal home is finished it’s Jason’s turn to explore a whole new universe. A sequel to Shutterbug; Jason meets Peter’s old friends and villains along with some new ones! Enjoy! (Not entirely canon compliment! It’s a combination!)(I DO NOT OWN ANY OF THE CHARACTERS! They belong to marvel and DC!! Besides the one OC that belongs to a friend!)

entry.title: once upon a broken boy (come back to me)
entry.summary:
Author: alleousai

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,422Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 2

Summary: “It happened when an undead certain red-helmeted menace got de-aged to a five-year-old little kid by pure circumstance and one Peter Benjamin Parker – Spider-Man – from a multiverse away had to handle his shit, for better or for worse.”   ↞↠   Jason gets de-aged all the while his brain is snapping back information at him. No one knows how he did or why or where he went, but one totally normal guy from another universe might just be the cure. But hey, Peter gets a job. And Bruce gets a second chance. (Peter and Jason only get together after Jason gets unaged!!)
